Structs/TableSection.html#/s:19Functiona.name: style
Structs/TableSection.html#/s:19Functiona.abstract: Specifies visual attributes to be applied to the section. This includes row separators to use at the top, bottom, and between items of the section.

Structs/TableSection.html#/s:19Functiona.name: didMoveRow
Structs/TableSection.html#/s:19Functiona.abstract: Callback executed when a row is manually moved by the user. It specifies the before and after index position.

Structs/TableSection.html#/s:19Functiona.name: append(_:)
Structs/TableSection.html#/s:19Functiona.abstract: Adds a row to the end of the array of rows.

Structs/TableSection.html#/s:19Functiona.name: mergedStyle(for:)
Structs/TableSection.html#/s:19Functiona.abstract: Attempts to merge the separator’s style provided by a TableSection with the separator’s style provided by an instance of CellConfigType.

Structs/HostCell.html#/s:19FunctionalTab.name: state
Structs/HostCell.html#/s:19FunctionalTab.abstract: Contains the state information of a cell.

Structs/HostCell.html#/s:19FunctionalTab.name: cellUpdater
Structs/HostCell.html#/s:19FunctionalTab.abstract: A function that updates a cell’s view to match the current state. It receives two values, the view instance and an optional state instance. The purpose of this function is to update the view to reflect that of the given state. The reason that the state is optional is because cells may move into the reuse queue. When this happens they no longer have a state and the updater function is called giving the opportunity to reset the view to its default value.

Structs/HostCell.html#/s:19FunctionalTab.name: register(with:)
Structs/HostCell.html#/s:19FunctionalTab.abstract: Registers the instance of this HostCell for use in creating new table cells.

Structs/HostCell.html#/s:19FunctionalTab.name: register(with:)
Structs/HostCell.html#/s:19FunctionalTab.abstract: Registers the instance of this HostCell for use in creating new table cells.

Structs/HostCell.html#/s:19FunctionalTab.name: dequeueCell(from:at:)
Structs/HostCell.html#/s:19FunctionalTab.abstract: Returns a reusable UITableView cell object for the specified reuse identifier and adds it to the table.

Structs/HostCell.html#/s:19FunctionalTab.name: dequeueCell(from:at:)
Structs/HostCell.html#/s:19FunctionalTab.abstract: Returns a reusable UICollectionView cell object for the specified reuse identifier and adds it to the collection.

Structs/CellActions.html#/s:19Functional.name: PreviewingViewControllerAction
Structs/CellActions.html#/s:19Functional.abstract: Closure type that is executed when the user 3D-touches on a cell

Structs/CellActions.html#/s:19Functional.name: canSelectAction
Structs/CellActions.html#/s:19Functional.abstract: The action to perform when the cell will be selected.

Structs/CellActions.html#/s:19Functional.name: selectionAction
Structs/CellActions.html#/s:19Functional.abstract: The action to perform when the cell is selected

Structs/CellActions.html#/s:19Functional.name: deselectionAction
Structs/CellActions.html#/s:19Functional.abstract: The action to perform when the cell is deselected

Structs/CellActions.html#/s:19Functional.name: rowActions
Structs/CellActions.html#/s:19Functional.abstract: All the available row actions this cell can perform. See UITableViewRowAction for more info.

Structs/CellActions.html#/s:19Functional.name: canPerformAction
Structs/CellActions.html#/s:19Functional.abstract: Indicates if the cell can perform a given action.

Structs/CellActions.html#/s:19Functional.name: canBeMoved
Structs/CellActions.html#/s:19Functional.abstract: Indicates if the cell can be manually moved by the user.

Structs/CellActions.html#/s:19Functional.name: visibilityAction
Structs/CellActions.html#/s:19Functional.abstract: The action to perform when the cell becomes visible.

Structs/CellActions.html#/s:19Functional.name: previewingViewControllerAction
Structs/CellActions.html#/s:19Functional.abstract: The action to perform when the cell is 3D touched by the user.

Structs/CellActions.html.name: CellActions
Structs/CellActions.html.abstract: The actions property exposed on the CellConfigType represents possible events that will be executed based on the users interaction with that particular cell. Of note are the selectionAction and previewingViewControllerAction. The selectionAction is executed when the user taps on that particular cell. The main use case for this is present a new detail view controller or a modal (but is not constrained to these actions, these are just the common use cases). The previewingViewControllerAction is responsible for returning an instance of a UIViewController that will be shown when a user 3D-touches on a cell.

Structs/HostCell.html.name: HostCell
Structs/HostCell.html.abstract: Defines the view, state and layout information of a row item inside a TableSection.

Protocols/FunctionalTableDataExceptionHa.name: handle(exception:)
Protocols/FunctionalTableDataExceptionHa.abstract: Handles the exception. This is only for debugging purposes, and commonly used

Protocols/TableSectionType.html#/s:19Fun.name: header
Protocols/TableSectionType.html#/s:19Fun.abstract: View object to display in the header of this section.

Protocols/TableSectionType.html#/s:19Fun.name: footer
Protocols/TableSectionType.html#/s:19Fun.abstract: View object to display in the footer of this section.

Protocols/TableSectionType.html#/s:19Fun.name: rows
Protocols/TableSectionType.html#/s:19Fun.abstract: Instances of CellConfigType that represent the rows in the table view.

Protocols/TableSectionType.html#/s:19Fun.name: headerVisibilityAction
Protocols/TableSectionType.html#/s:19Fun.abstract: Action to perform when the header view comes in or out of view.

Protocols/CellConfigType.html#/s:19Funct.name: style
Protocols/CellConfigType.html#/s:19Funct.abstract: Indicates a cell style. See CellStyle for more information.

Protocols/CellConfigType.html#/s:19Funct.name: actions
Protocols/CellConfigType.html#/s:19Funct.abstract: Indicates all the possible actions a cell can perform. See CellActions for more information.

Protocols/CellConfigType.html#/s:19Funct.name: update(cell:in:)
Protocols/CellConfigType.html#/s:19Funct.abstract: Update the view state of a UITableViewCell. It is up to implementors of the protocol to determine what this means.

Protocols/CellConfigType.html#/s:19Funct.name: update(cell:in:)
Protocols/CellConfigType.html#/s:19Funct.abstract: Update the view state of a UICollectionViewCell. It is up to implementors of the protocol to determine what this means.

Protocols/CellConfigType.html#/s:19Funct.name: isEqual(_:)
Protocols/CellConfigType.html#/s:19Funct.abstract: Compares two cells for equality. Cells will be considered equal if they are of the same type and their states also compare equal.

Protocols/CellConfigType.html.name: CellConfigType
Protocols/CellConfigType.html.abstract: A type that provides the information required by FunctionalTableData to generate cells.

Protocols/Reusable.html.name: Reusable
Protocols/Reusable.html.abstract: A type that identifies a dequeueable object. Used by FunctionalTableData to increase performance by reusing objects when it needs to, just like UITableView and UICollectionView.

Protocols/TableSectionType.html.name: TableSectionType
Protocols/TableSectionType.html.abstract: A type with the information about a section.

Protocols/FunctionalTableDataExceptionHa.name: FunctionalTableDataExceptionHandler
Protocols/FunctionalTableDataExceptionHa.abstract: A type that provides the debugging information when an exception occurs.

Extensions/UITableView.html#/s:So11UITab.name: render()
Extensions/UITableView.html#/s:So11UITab.abstract: Initiates a layout pass of UITableView and its items. Necessary for calculating new

Extensions/UITableView.html#/s:So11UITab.name: deselectLastSelectedRow(animated:)
Extensions/UITableView.html#/s:So11UITab.abstract: Deselects the previously selected row, with an option to animate the deselection.

Extensions/UITableView.html#/s:So11UITab.name: indexPath(for:)
Extensions/UITableView.html#/s:So11UITab.abstract: Find the IndexPath for a particular view. Returns nil if the view is not an instance of, or a subview of UITableViewCell, or if that cell is not a child of self

Extensions/UICollectionView.html#/s:So16.name: render()
Extensions/UICollectionView.html#/s:So16.abstract: Initiates a layout pass of UICollectionView and its items. Necessary for calculating new

Extensions/UICollectionView.html#/s:So16.name: deselectLastSelectedItem(animated:)
Extensions/UICollectionView.html#/s:So16.abstract: Deselects the previously selected row, with an option to animate the deselection.

Extensions/UICollectionView.html#/s:So16.name: indexPath(for:)
Extensions/UICollectionView.html#/s:So16.abstract: Find the IndexPath for a particular view. Returns nil if the view is not an instance of, or a subview of UICollectionViewCell, or if that cell is not a child of self

Classes/FunctionalTableData/KeyPath.html.name: rowKey
Classes/FunctionalTableData/KeyPath.html.abstract: Unique identifier for an item inside a section.

Classes/FunctionalTableData/Exception.ht.name: Exception
Classes/FunctionalTableData/Exception.ht.abstract: A type that provides the information about an exception.

Classes/FunctionalTableData/KeyPath.html.name: KeyPath
Classes/FunctionalTableData/KeyPath.html.abstract: Represents the unique path to a given item in the FunctionalTableData.

Classes/FunctionalTableData/TableAnimati.name: TableAnimations
Classes/FunctionalTableData/TableAnimati.abstract: The type of animation when rows and sections are inserted or deleted.

Classes/FunctionalTableData.html#/s:19Fu.name: isRendering
Classes/FunctionalTableData.html#/s:19Fu.abstract: A Boolean value that returns true when a renderAndDiff pass is currently running.

Classes/FunctionalTableData.html#/s:19Fu.name: rowForKeyPath(_:)
Classes/FunctionalTableData.html#/s:19Fu.abstract: Returns the cell identified by a key path.

Classes/FunctionalTableData.html#/s:19Fu.name: keyPathForRowKey(_:)
Classes/FunctionalTableData.html#/s:19Fu.abstract: Returns the key path specified by its string presentation.

Classes/FunctionalTableData.html#/s:19Fu.name: keyPathForIndexPath(indexPath:)
Classes/FunctionalTableData.html#/s:19Fu.abstract: Returns the key path of the cell in a given IndexPath location.

Classes/FunctionalTableData.html#/s:19Fu.name: rectForKeyPath(_:)
Classes/FunctionalTableData.html#/s:19Fu.abstract: Returns the drawing area for a row identified by key path.

Classes/FunctionalTableData.html#/s:19Fu.name: renderAndDiff(_:keyPath:animated:animations:completion:)
Classes/FunctionalTableData.html#/s:19Fu.abstract: Populates the table with the specified sections, and asynchronously updates the table view to reflect the cells and sections that have changed.

Classes/FunctionalTableData.html#/s:19Fu.name: renderAndDiff(_:animated:animations:completion:)
Classes/FunctionalTableData.html#/s:19Fu.abstract: Populates the table with the specified sections, and asynchronously updates the table view to reflect the cells and sections that have changed.

Classes/FunctionalTableData.html#/s:19Fu.name: select(keyPath:animated:scrollPosition:triggerDelegate:)
Classes/FunctionalTableData.html#/s:19Fu.abstract: Selects a row in the table view identified by a key path.

Classes/FunctionalTableData.html#/s:19Fu.name: scroll(to:animated:scrollPosition:)
Classes/FunctionalTableData.html#/s:19Fu.abstract: Scrolls to the item at the specified key path.

Classes/FunctionalTableData.html#/c:@CM@.name: scrollViewDidChangeContentSize(_:)
Classes/FunctionalTableData.html#/c:@CM@.abstract: This is an undocumented optional UIScrollViewDelegate method that is not exposed by the public protocol

Classes/FunctionalCollectionData/KeyPath.name: rowKey
Classes/FunctionalCollectionData/KeyPath.abstract: Unique identifier for an item inside a section.

Classes/FunctionalCollectionData/KeyPath.name: KeyPath
Classes/FunctionalCollectionData/KeyPath.abstract: Represents the unique path to a given item in the FunctionalCollectionData.

Classes/FunctionalCollectionData.html#/s.name: indexPathForPreviouslySelectedRow
Classes/FunctionalCollectionData.html#/s.abstract: Index path for the previously selected row.

Classes/FunctionalCollectionData.html#/s.name: isRendering
Classes/FunctionalCollectionData.html#/s.abstract: A Boolean value that returns true when a renderAndDiff pass is currently running.

Classes/FunctionalCollectionData.html#/s.name: rowForKeyPath(_:)
Classes/FunctionalCollectionData.html#/s.abstract: Returns the cell identified by a key path.

Classes/FunctionalCollectionData.html#/s.name: keyPathForRowKey(_:)
Classes/FunctionalCollectionData.html#/s.abstract: Returns the key path specified by its string presentation.

Classes/FunctionalCollectionData.html#/s.name: keyPathForIndexPath(indexPath:)
Classes/FunctionalCollectionData.html#/s.abstract: Returns the key path of the cell in a given IndexPath location.

Classes/FunctionalCollectionData.html#/s.name: renderAndDiff(_:keyPath:animated:completion:)
Classes/FunctionalCollectionData.html#/s.abstract: Populates the collection with the specified sections, and asynchronously updates the collection view to reflect the cells and sections that have changed.

Classes/FunctionalCollectionData.html#/s.name: renderAndDiff(_:animated:completion:)
Classes/FunctionalCollectionData.html#/s.abstract: Populates the collection with the specified sections, and asynchronously updates the collection view to reflect the cells and sections that have changed.

Classes/FunctionalCollectionData.html#/s.name: select(keyPath:animated:scrollPosition:triggerDelegate:)
Classes/FunctionalCollectionData.html#/s.abstract: Selects a row in the collection view identified by a key path.

Classes/FunctionalCollectionData.html#/s.name: scroll(to:animated:scrollPosition:)
Classes/FunctionalCollectionData.html#/s.abstract: Scrolls to the item at the specified key path.

Classes/FunctionalCollectionData.html#/c.name: scrollViewDidChangeContentSize(_:)
Classes/FunctionalCollectionData.html#/c.abstract: This is an undocumented optional UIScrollViewDelegate method that is not exposed by the public protocol

Typealiases.html.name: Type Aliases
Typealiases.html.abstract: The following type aliases are available globally.
